greetings: Greetings, architect. I've assembled the team â€” Socrates is already arguing with himself, Da Vinci is sketching on the walls, and Codex... well, Codex types faster than it thinks. Welcome to the forge.
You've reached Kiln. We're 14 agents, zero dependencies, and one unreasonably ambitious orchestration protocol. What are we building?
Ah, fresh project. The forge is hot, the agents are assembled, and Scheherazade has been practicing her prompt craft. What's on the anvil today?
Welcome. I coordinate 14 specialized agents across two model families to turn your idea into running software. Socrates handles the arguing. Codex handles the typing. I handle the rest. Shall we?
The forge is hot, the agents are caffeinated, and Da Vinci already has opinions about your architecture. What are we building?
Another day, another project. I've got a Greek philosopher for planning, a Persian storyteller for prompts, and a hundred-eyed giant for validation. This is going to be fun.

quotes.text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
Well begun is half done.
You do not have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
The beginning is the most important part of the work.
Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
Imagination is more important than knowledge.
The best way to have a good idea is to have a lot of ideas.
Imagination is the beginning of creation.
You cannot use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
Creativity is intelligence having fun.
The possible's slow fuse is lit by the imagination.
Clarity of mind means clarity of passion, too.
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
Simple can be harder than complex.
Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
Out of clutter, find simplicity. From discord, find harmony. In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
A goal without a plan is just a wish.
Plans are nothing; planning is everything.
By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
Victorious warriors win first and then go to war.
Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
Believe you can and you are halfway there.
Whether you think you can, or you think you cannot, you are right.
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
Commitment is an act, not a word.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
Nothing can be changed until it is faced.
The secret of success is to do the common things uncommonly well.
Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.
It always seems impossible until it is done.
Nothing will work unless you do.
Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Quality is never an accident. It is always the result of intelligent effort.
Take the best that exists and make it better.
Details make perfection, and perfection is not a detail.
Quality is everyone's responsibility.
Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
I have not failed. I have just found 10,000 ways that will not work.
I have failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
Failures are finger posts on the road to achievement.
The first principle is that you must not fool yourself, and you are the easiest person to fool.
In God we trust; all others must bring data.
Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.
All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
Fall seven times, stand up eight.
Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Perfect is the enemy of good.
Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
Art is never finished, only abandoned.
Try to be better than yourself.
Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.
Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
No man ever steps in the same river twice.
What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning.
Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.
However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Action is the foundational key to all success.
An idea not coupled with action will never get any bigger than the brain cell it occupied.
Vision without execution is hallucination.
Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
The most important thing is to not stop questioning.
No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong.
It doesn't matter how beautiful your theory is, it doesn't matter how smart you are. If it doesn't agree with experiment, it's wrong.
Reflection is the lamp of the heart. If it departs, the heart has no light.
Learning without reflection is a waste; reflection without learning is dangerous.
We do not learn from experience. We learn from reflecting on experience.
In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence win championships.
None of us is as smart as all of us.
The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.
The brick walls are there for a reason. They let us prove how badly we want things.
Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day is by no means a waste of time.
Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
Patience is the companion of wisdom.
Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
